definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])

sentences.english: It took another half an hour before he limped back.
sentences.chinese: 又过了半个小时，他才一瘸一拐地回来。

sentences.english: After almost a year of physical therapy, I still had the limp.
sentences.chinese: 经过几乎一整年的物理治疗，我还是一瘸一拐。

sentences.english: That creature had gone a little way when she began to limp and show every sign of being footsore.
sentences.chinese: 那个家伙走不多远，就一瘸一拐地显出脚痛的样子。

sentences.english: He waddled off and hoped Mormont would follow.
sentences.chinese: 他一瘸一拐的走开，希望莫尔蒙会跟上。

sentences.english: He hitched along with his wounded leg.
sentences.chinese: 他拖着伤腿一瘸一拐地走了。

sentences.english: His crippled left leg makes him limp.
sentences.chinese: 他左腿跛了，走起路来一瘸一拐地。

sentences.english: Soon she was limping, and then she couldn’t walk at all.
sentences.chinese: 很快她变得一瘸一拐，然后就完全无法自己走路了。

sentences.english: A dog limped below, ears flat, tail between its legs.
sentences.chinese: 一只狗耷拉着耳朵，夹着尾巴在下面一瘸一拐地走。

sentences.english: He was limping as badly as ever when I last saw him.
sentences.chinese: 他走起路来一瘸一拐地，和我上次见到他一样。

sentences.english: The old man limped away on the stick.
sentences.chinese: 老人拄着拐杖一瘸一拐地走开了。

sentences.english: He is lame in the left leg and he walks lamely.
sentences.chinese: 他左腿跛了，走起路来一瘸一拐的。

sentences.english: As he limped along, the Elephant heared the voices of men nearby.
sentences.chinese: 大象一瘸一拐地走着，突然听到附近有人声。

sentences.english: He is born with a slight deformity of the feet which makes him limp.
sentences.chinese: 他的脚稍有先天畸形，走起路来一瘸一拐的。

definition: to walk unsteadily/to stagger/to lurch/to hobble/to totter
to lend an arm to support sb
to sprain (one's ankle)/see 崴子[wai3 zi5]
at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
rolling and crawling/trying frantically to escape (idiom)
to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
